item.title: Door U/D FLT LK Indication – Freighter without Draw-Through Smoke Detection System

numlitem.para: Each upper deck type "A" door is verified to be capable of being unlatched before each departure, and
DOOR U/D GND MODE lights above each upper deck Type "A" door is operative.

placard.para: Install Placard below Captain's PFD on P-1-1 on affected door: "____ U/D DOOR GRD MODE LIGHTS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify both upper deck type A doors are capable of being unlatched.
Place the mode selector lever in the MANUAL position.

caution.para: DO NOT RAISE INSIDE HANDLE WHEN DOOR IS IN AUTOMATIC MODE. DOOR WILL OPEN RAPIDLY AND SLIDE WILL BE DEPLOYED AND INFLATED.

numlitem.para: Rotate the inside handle to the open position. Door should translate upward approximately 2 inches.
Rotate the inside handle downward to the latched position.
Ensure both DOOR U/D GND MODE lights operate normally.
Energize all 28 V DC Buses.
Remove the flight lock actuator access panel. (These are the 10-inch square access panels located in the door upper lining just left of the inside handle)
Rotate the flight lock lever arm until it comes in contact with the inside handle shaft and verify the message DOOR U/D GND MODE light is extinguished.
Release the flight lock lever arm and verify the DOOR U/D GND MODE light is illuminated.

warning.para: refer to amm 32-09-02/201. put the air/ground relay system in the air mode. automatic operation of aircraft systems In the air mode can cause injury or damage.

numlitem.para: Put the air/ground relay system in the air mode (AMM 32-09-02/201).
Open 180G02 LH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the DOOR U/D GND MODE light above the left hand door is illuminated.
Close 180G02 LH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the DOOR U/D GND MODE light above the left hand door is extinguished.
Open 180D02 RH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the DOOR U/D GND MODE light above the right hand door is illuminated.
Close 180D02 RH UPR DK DR FLT LK circuit breaker on the P180 CR Power Distribution Panel.
Check that the DOOR U/D GND MODE light above the right hand door is extinguished.
Put the air/ground relay system back to the ground mode (AMM 32-09-02/201).
Restore the flight lock actuator access panel.
